Title:
Penicillium viticola, a new species isolated from a grape in
Japan
Keywords:
Calmodulin gene, Penicillium viticola sp. nov.,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
A new monoverticillate Penicillium species (subgenus
Aspergilloides Dierckx), P. viticola was isolated from a grape
cultivated in Yamanashi Prefecture, Japan. Morphologically, P. viticola
is characterized by the production slightly roughened conidia, slightly
roughened stipes and rapid growth on 25% glycerol nitrate agar (G25N).
This species is phylogenetically close to P. angulare S.W. Peterson,
E.M. Bayer & Wicklow, but differs with respect to colonial
characteristics and conidia and penicilli morphology.

trees.title:
Penicillium viticola, a new species isolated from a
grape in Japan
